# JOSHUA OLIPHANT
## SENIOR SITE RELIABILITY ENGINEER
joshua.oliphant@hey.com | 360-333-0114  
https://www.linkedin.com/in/joshuaoliphant/ | https://blog.anoliphantneverforgets.com/

## Summary
• Experienced Site Reliability Engineer with 8+ years focusing on distributed systems, infrastructure automation, and observability solutions.
• Strong background in Kubernetes orchestration, infrastructure as code, monitoring systems, and incident management.
• Expertise in Python automation, CI/CD pipelines, and performance optimization of cloud-native applications.
• Proven track record of implementing reliable, scalable solutions and maintaining high system availability.

## Skills
• **Infrastructure & Orchestration:** Kubernetes, Docker, Containerization, Helm, Tilt
• **Observability & Monitoring:** Prometheus, Grafana, Performance Optimization, Distributed Systems
• **Automation & CI/CD:** GitLab, TravisCI, CI/CD Pipelines, Infrastructure as Code
• **Cloud Platforms:** AWS (experienced with cloud migration to GCP)
• **Programming:** Python, Java, Automation Scripting
• **Incident Management:** On-call experience, Post-mortem analysis, SLO/SLI implementation
• **Messaging & Architecture:** Kafka, Strimzi, Microservices, REST APIs

## Work History

### Senior Software Developer
**Nortal US** | August 2019 - April 2024

As a consultant at Nortal, I've leveraged my expertise in Java microservices, Python automation, Kubernetes, Docker, and CI/CD pipelines across various projects, focusing on secure, scalable, and innovative solutions with an emphasis on cloud services and DevOps practices.

**Key Projects:**

• **T-Mobile (Site Reliability Engineer)** | Jan 2022 - April 2024
  - Implemented comprehensive monitoring and alerting solutions for microservices, reducing incident response time by 40%.
  - Led Docker containerization of Java/Spring Boot microservices, improving application scalability and establishing SLOs for performance metrics.
  - Orchestrated deployments using GitLab CI/CD pipelines and Helm for Kubernetes services, creating self-healing systems.
  - Spearheaded Kafka cluster creation in Kubernetes with Strimzi, enhancing data processing capabilities while maintaining 99.9% uptime.

• **Motorola Solutions (Senior Software Engineer)** | Feb 2021 - Dec 2021
  - Developed Azure DevOps CI/CD pipelines for FedRamp environment transitions.
  - Focused on high-quality C#/.Net microservices development.

• **Amazon (Software Engineer)** | Sep 2020 - Jan 2021
  - Led a team to architect and implement distributed systems using AWS services (Lambda, Kinesis, DynamoDB, S3, Glue) for high-volume data processing.
  - Developed monitoring solutions and alerting thresholds to maintain system reliability across distributed components.
  - Authored Java AWS Lambdas for reliable data processing within Step Functions, implementing automated recovery mechanisms for failed executions.

• **Brightloom (Software Engineer)** | Feb 2020 - Sep 2020
  - Designed and implemented infrastructure as code using Terraform to create reproducible, version-controlled cloud architecture.
  - Developed Python microservices with Django in startup environments, demonstrating autonomous problem-solving and adaptability.
  - Built CI/CD pipelines with TravisCI, managed Docker Kubernetes microservices, and established observable metrics for all deployed services.

• **Expedia Group (Software Engineer)** | Aug 2019 - Jan 2020
  - Constructed Java microservices and updated Lua services to enhance data pipeline efficiency.
  - Integrated Kafka for data transformation and deployed solutions on AWS ECS, showcasing cloud expertise.

### Software Engineer II
**Nordstrom** | June 2015 - August 2019

**Key Projects:**

• **Kubernetes Customer Engineer** | Aug 2018 - Aug 2019
  - Led Kubernetes Customer Engineering Initiative to provide a point-of-contact for other teams at Nordstrom, implementing best practices and solving complex operational challenges.
  - Established incident management processes, conducting thorough post-mortems and developing runbooks that reduced MTTR by 35%.
  - Designed and implemented monitoring dashboards with Prometheus and Grafana for 50+ node Kubernetes clusters, providing real-time visibility into system health.
  - Provided on-call support, ensuring system stability by automating responses to common failure scenarios and maintaining high availability SLAs.

• **Software Engineer** | Aug 2015 - May 2018
  - Contributed to the modernization of Nordstrom's point-of-sale systems, focusing on Java Spring Boot and Kafka for event-driven microservices.
  - Played a key role in the Point-of-Sale system's transition to a microservices architecture.
  - Became an Apache Kafka SME, deepening expertise in event-driven architecture.

## Education
**B.S COMPUTER SCIENCE - SEATTLE UNIVERSITY** - Graduated June 2016
